Replace.Text: Unlock the characteristic strategic resource [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power, and a series of special projects using [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power. [NEWLINE]Cannot produce pioneers, but the transformed emptiness can open up cities.
Unlock Empty <Castle> and provide corresponding [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power.
Unlock the empty <Knight> and provide the corresponding [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power.
Unlock the empty <bishop> and provide the corresponding [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power.

The White Queen's special items have the following effects: [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Aries Bullet: {LOC_PROJECT_LUCIFUGE_ARIES_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] Taurus Sword: {LOC_PROJECT_LUCIFUGE_TAURUS_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] Gemini Bullet: {LOC_PROJECT_LUCIFUGE_GEMINI_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] Cancer Sword: {LOC_PROJECT_LUCIFUGE_CANCER_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] Lion's Bullet: {LOC_PROJECT_LUCIFUGE_LEO_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] Otome Sword: {LOC_PROJECT_LUCIFUGE_VIRGO_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] Bullet of Libra: {LOC_PROJECT_LUCIFUGE_LIBRA_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] Scorpio Bullet: {LOC_PROJECT_LUCIFUGE_SCORPIO_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] Archer's Sword: {LOC_PROJECT_LUCIFUGE_SAGITTARIUS_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] Capricorn Bullet: {LOC_PROJECT_LUCIFUGE_CAPRICORN_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] Aquarius Bullet: {LOC_PROJECT_LUCIFUGE_AQUARIUS_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] Pisces Bullet: {LOC_PROJECT_LUCIFUGE_PISCES_DESCRIPTION}
Mad Emperor: Bullet of the Aries
The White Queen's special item requires [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power, and all current military units +7 [ICON_Strength] combat power, which lasts for 9 rounds.
+7[ICON_Strength] Combat strength comes from the Bullet of the Aries
Mad Emperor: Sword of the Taurus

The White Queen's characteristic project requires [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power, and the output can be obtained according to the excess luxury resources held and the resources in this city.

The White Queen's characteristic item requires [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power. A emptiness currently located in the city's territory will be upgraded to a soldier, and if there is no emptiness, it will get emptiness.
The White Queen's special item requires [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power, and all empty units will cause an extra damage in the next battle.
The White Queen's special item requires [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power to add a lion's bullet to your national property, which is a weapon of mass destruction.

The White Queen's characteristic project requires [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power to increase the loyalty pressure that this city spreads to itself and surrounding cities. Warring countries are forced to make peace, and other countries are forced to declare friends.
The White Queen's special item requires [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spirit power, and all empty units can reflect non-lethal damage once.
The Mad Emperor: The Bullet of the Eight Scorpions

The White Queen's special item requires [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power. The empty <soldier> currently located in the city's territory will be promoted to a cadre, and if there is no soldier, it will get a soldier.

The White Queen's characteristic item requires [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power. The empty <soldiers> currently located in the city's territory will be upgraded to chariots, and soldiers will be obtained if there are no soldiers.

The White Queen's special item requires [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power. The empty <soldier> currently located in the city's territory will be upgraded to a knight. If there are no soldiers, soldiers will be obtained.

The White Queen's special item requires [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power. The empty <soldier> currently located in the city's territory will be upgraded to a bishop. If there are no soldiers, soldiers will be obtained.

The White Queen's special item requires [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power. The empty <soldier> currently located in the city's territory will be upgraded to a queen. If there are no soldiers, soldiers will be obtained.
Mad Emperor: Sword of the Archer
The White Queen's characteristic item requires [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power to send all enemy units currently in the city's territory back to the country's capital.
The White Queen's special item requires [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power to convert a military/economic/foreign policy slot into a general policy slot.
The White Queen's special item requires [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power to convert a military policy slot into a general policy slot.
White Queen's characteristic item requires [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power to convert an economic policy slot into a general policy slot.
The White Queen's special item requires [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power to convert a foreign policy slot into a general policy slot.

The White Queen's characteristic item requires [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power. The military units currently located in the city's territory will recover 11 points of health at the beginning of the round and last for 9 rounds.
Restores 11 HP at the start of the turn.
The White Queen's characteristic project requires [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power, +1 [ICON_Housing] housing in all current areas of the city.

Can switch between the following abilities: [NEWLINE] General: {LOC_BUILDING_PERSONA_GENERAL_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] Missy: {LOC_BUILDING_PERSONA_LADY_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] Politician: {LOC_BUILDING_PERSONA_POLITICIAN_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] Worker: {LOC_BUILDING_PERSONA_AGENT_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] Executioner: {LOC_BUILDING_PERSONA_EXECUTIONER_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] God: {LOC_BUILDING_PERSONA_OVERLORD_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] With personality abilities enabled, units that are within cell range 1 of an empty mound can now be airlifted to any other cell near one of the empty mounds. [NEWLINE] In addition, when occupying a city, the corresponding [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power will be obtained according to the population of the city [ICON_Citizen].

Cities do not experience war weariness. Produced military units receive a promotion. 80% discount on the cost of strategic resources needed to produce units. All nuclear weapons project [ICON_Production] production increased by 33%.

Chance to capture enemy military units and turn them into nothingness. The cost of recruiting city-state units is halved, and they are given +2 [ICON_Movement] mobility and +5 [ICON_Strength] combat power. [ICON_Gold] gold and resources spent when collecting unit upgrades -75%.
Chance to capture enemy military units and turn them into nothingness.

Nulls produced +1 build count. The number of constructions can be used to speed up the progress of wonders and areas by 20%. Your city gets the [ICON_Production] production bonus from all nearby Industrial Zone buildings that have area bonuses, not just the first one.

Military units can cross national borders. Enemy spies will perform espionage at a level 3 lower than normal. Every Spy starts with a free upgrade to Agent. [ICON_VisLimited] The combat power bonus of diplomatic visibility is doubled. Defeating an enemy unit within an enemy city's borders will cause the city to lose [ICON_Loyalty].
The unit can enter foreign territory even if the borders are not open.

Military units are immune to enemy zone of control and do not suffer combat debuffs when wounded. When attacking wounded units, all units +5 [ICON_Strength] combat strength. Gain [ICON_Strength] combat power boost from adjacent dead units (up to 10 points).
Immune to enemy zone of control, no combat debuffs when injured
Possesses the abilities of all personalities, but consumes additional [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power every round.

When killing a unit in battle, gain 3 [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time. Provides additional [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time as the [ICON_Citizen] population of the [ICON_Capital] capital grows. [NEWLINE] Kekedi can only use bullets one to nine.

Tokisaki Kuro's three special items have the following effects: [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] First bullet: {LOC_PROJECT_ZAFKIEL_ALEPH_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] The second round: {LOC_PROJECT_ZAFKIEL_BET_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] Third bullet: {LOC_PROJECT_ZAFKIEL_GIMEL_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] Fourth bullet: {LOC_PROJECT_ZAFKIEL_DALET_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] Fifth bullet: {LOC_PROJECT_ZAFKIEL_HEI_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] Sixth Bullet: {LOC_PROJECT_ZAFKIEL_VAV_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] Seventh Bullet: {LOC_PROJECT_ZAFKIEL_ZAYIN_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] The Eighth Bullet: {LOC_PROJECT_ZAFKIEL_HET_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] Nine Bullets: {LOC_PROJECT_ZAFKIEL_TET_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] Ten bullets: {LOC_PROJECT_ZAFKIEL_YUD_DESCRIPTION}

When killing a unit in battle, gain 3 [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time. Provides additional [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time as the [ICON_Citizen] population of the [ICON_Capital] capital grows. [NEWLINE] Kekedi can only use Aries Bullet to Lion Bullet.

Tokisaki Kuro's three special items have the following effects: [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] First bullet: {LOC_PROJECT_ZAFKIEL_ALEPH_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] The second round: {LOC_PROJECT_ZAFKIEL_BET_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] Third bullet: {LOC_PROJECT_ZAFKIEL_GIMEL_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] Fourth bullet: {LOC_PROJECT_ZAFKIEL_DALET_DESCRIPTION}[NEWLINE] Fifth bullet: {LOC_PROJECT_ZAFKIEL_HEI_DESCRIPTION}

When killing a unit in battle, gain 3 [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time. Provides additional [ICON_Resource_Kurumi_Time] time as the [ICON_Citizen] population of the [ICON_Capital] capital grows. [NEWLINE] Kekedi can only use Aries Bullet and Taurus Bullet.

Likes civilizations that follow the same religion, and wants all of their cities to follow the same religion. Hate civilizations that try to spread other religions in their own country. [NEWLINE]Hate barbarians. Likes to clear civilizations of barbarian outposts. Hates civilizations that ignore barbarian outposts. [NEWLINE]Likes fighting between civilizations and believes in long-term warfare. Always managed to maintain a strong standing army. Respect other civilizations with large armies. [NEWLINE]Don't hesitate to use nuclear weapons. Respect civilizations that possess the power of nuclear weapons and equipment. [NEWLINE]Armies will be raised from city-states. Likes civilizations that also use city-state armies, and dislikes civilizations that are noncommittal to mercenaries. [NEWLINE]Want to stop humans from orbiting the globe or going into space. [NEWLINE]Dislikes civs that are struggling to win diplomatic victories. [NEWLINE]Will try to loot all cells possible. Respect other civilizations that like to plunder. [NEWLINE][COLOR_RED] hates Tokisaki Kurumi. [ENDCOLOR]
The White Queen unique build unit that replaces the builder. [NEWLINE]It takes [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] to produce. [NEWLINE]Cannot be captured, but will retreat to a neighboring city.

Unique support unit for the White Queen, replacing the Military Engineer. It needs to consume [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power to produce. [NEWLINE][ICON_Strength] Combat strength is additionally enhanced with the advancement of the times. [NEWLINE][COLOR:Red] cannot be directly produced in this era if the production quantity exceeds the era limit. [ENDCOLOR]

The White Queen unique melee unit. It needs to consume [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power to produce. [NEWLINE][ICON_Strength] Combat strength is additionally enhanced with the advancement of the times. [NEWLINE]+5 [ICON_Strength] combat strength when besieging an area. 50% extra support bonus. Can climb cliffs. [NEWLINE][COLOR:Red] cannot be directly produced in this era if the production quantity exceeds the era limit. [ENDCOLOR]

The White Queen unique cavalry unit. It needs to consume [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power to produce. [NEWLINE][ICON_Strength] Combat strength is additionally enhanced with the advancement of the times. [NEWLINE]One point of [ICON_Movement] movement can be consumed to loot. Can use extremely high [ICON_Movement] mobility to escort moving civilians and support units. [NEWLINE][COLOR:Red] cannot be directly produced in this era if the production quantity exceeds the era limit. [ENDCOLOR]

The White Queen unique ranged unit. It needs to consume [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power to produce. [NEWLINE][ICON_Strength] Combat strength is additionally enhanced with the advancement of the times. [NEWLINE]A relic is created upon death. Can heal adjacent units. [NEWLINE]The "Cause Hazards" action can be used to start random disasters in the space next to the unit. [NEWLINE][COLOR:Red] cannot be directly produced in this era if the production quantity exceeds the era limit. [ENDCOLOR]

White Queen unique super unit. It needs to consume [ICON_Resource_Queen_Spirit] spiritual power to produce. [NEWLINE][ICON_Strength] Combat strength is additionally enhanced with the advancement of the times. [NEWLINE]Within two cells, +5 [ICON_Strength] combat power and +1 [ICON_Movement] movement power for land units, like a general. [NEWLINE][COLOR:Red] cannot be directly produced in this era if the production quantity exceeds the era limit. [ENDCOLOR]
Summons an Automated Disaster Mech in all other players' capitals.
Barbarian unique super unit. Can only be summoned by featured items.
Ignores the zone of control. Can cross borders.
[ICON_Strength] Combat strength is additionally enhanced with the advancement of the times.

[ICON_Strength] Combat strength is additionally enhanced with the advancement of the times. [NEWLINE]+5 [ICON_Strength] combat strength when besieging an area. 50% extra support bonus. Can climb cliffs.

[ICON_Strength] Combat strength is additionally enhanced with the advancement of the times. [NEWLINE]One point of [ICON_Movement] movement can be consumed to loot. Can use extremely high [ICON_Movement] mobility to escort moving civilians and support units.

[ICON_Strength] Combat strength is additionally enhanced with the advancement of the times. [NEWLINE]A relic is created upon death. Can heal adjacent units. [NEWLINE]The "Cause Hazards" action can be used to start random disasters in the space next to the unit.

[ICON_Strength] Combat strength is additionally enhanced with the advancement of the times. [NEWLINE]Within two cells, +5 [ICON_Strength] combat power and +1 [ICON_Movement] movement power for land units, like a general.
Additional +5 [ICON_Strength] combat strength when adjacent to the general. When fighting in enemy territory, there is a chance to be promoted to a soldier.
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking in the area. +7 [ICON_Strength] combat strength when fighting with units in the area.
Double side attack bonus, support bonus.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting other heavily armored units, +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for each type of adjacent unit.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting damaged units. Does not suffer combat debuffs when injured.

Additional +5 [ICON_Strength] combat strength when adjacent to the general. +5 Grand General points when killing an enemy unit. When fighting in enemy territory, there is a chance to be promoted to a cadre.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when within 4 cells of friendly territory. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in or near the Empire's territory.
All adjacent enemy units -10 [ICON_Strength] combat strength.
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in the Capital Continent. Restores health in neutral territory.
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on continents other than the capital. Restores health in enemy territory.
Recovers at the end of each turn, even after moving or attacking. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when flanked. No combat debuffs while taking damage.
+2 [ICON_Movement] Movement at start of turn in enemy territory. Can move after attacking.
The vision is able to travel through and through woods and rainforests. +1 vision range.
Each point of unused [ICON_Movement] movement power will provide +3 [ICON_Strength] combat strength.
If [ICON_Movement] mobility allows, +1 extra attack per round. Can move after attacking.
No movement penalty for all terrain and crossing rivers. +2 [ICON_Movement] movement if the unit starts its turn on open terrain.
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when in the same grid as religious units.
If the unit occupies a city, or is adjacent to a city when it is captured, the city automatically adopts the owning player's religion as the dominant religion.
Only adjacent enemy units can spot this unit. Can reveal other invisible units.
This unit spreads its religion to surrounding cities when it kills an enemy unit.
Surrounding units also gain the following abilities: Invisibility, Ignore Zone of Control, and Cross Borders.
+3 [ICON_Movement] movement. Can perform jumping actions to climb over mountainous terrain.

+10[ICON_Strength] combat strength when attacking area defense, +7[ICON_RANGED] long-range combat strength. 100% efficiency when attacking cities and camps from a distance, and +30 [ICON_RANGED] long-range combat power.
If mobility allows, additional attacks can be made each round.
Directly attack support units without destroying combat units. +12[ICON_RANGED] ranged combat power when fighting land units, +7[ICON_RANGED] long-range combat power when fighting naval units.

Obtain [ICON_Science] technology value from killing in the capital continent, and obtain [ICON_Culture] culture value from killing in other continents. Increase [ICON_Strength] combat power when a unit dies in an adjacent cell.

White Queen's characteristic building. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Generate [ICON_RESOURCE_QUEEN_SPIRIT] spiritual power. +1 [ICON_Faith] faith value. After unlocking "Natural History", +1 [ICON_Culture] culture value. After researching and developing "Flying", you will get [ICON_Tourism] tourism performance from [ICON_Faith] faith value. Cannot be built on hills or adjacent to other mounds.
The White Queen featured area. Replaces the entertainment center area. [NEWLINE]Gives +3 [ICON_Amenities] satisfaction and is less expensive to craft. Cannot be built in a city with a "Water Park".
+{1_num} [ICON_Culture] culture value from adjacent Hippodrome area.

The White Queen's characteristic area replaces the industrial area. Not only is it cheaper to build, it can be built earlier, and it is not subject to population restrictions. [NEWLINE]The settlement is a defensive area with ranged attack capabilities. After the first settlement is built, the "apprentice" technology will be unlocked immediately. [NEWLINE]Have a chance to gain a void when settlements and buildings in the area are built. [NEWLINE]Gain an adjacency bonus of +2 [ICON_Production] Production for each Quarry Improvement or Strategic Resource adjacent to.

The White Queen unique building, which replaces the Barracks. [NEWLINE]All melee and ranged land units trained in this city gain +25% combat experience. When creating a non-civilian unit in this city, you can get [ICON_Science] technology value equal to 25% of the cost of the unit. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Strategic resource hoarding +10 (at standard speed). [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Cannot be built in a campsite area that already has a stall.
Gain bonus XP from Queen's Academy.
White Queen Featured Chief Executive. Can be assigned to all domestic cities and capitals of civilizations.

+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for all friendly units fighting within the city territory. The city gets an extra [ICON_Ranged] long-range attack opportunity every round. Military units trained in this city receive one free boost if they did not start with a free boost. Can be appointed quickly.

City garrisons and units defending within city territory +5 [ICON_Strength] combat strength. When attacking the defensive area, all units within 10 cells from the city center will have +10 [ICON_Strength] combat strength.

The city cannot be besieged. The espionage level of enemy spies in this city is greatly reduced. When assuming a foreign [ICON_Capital] capital, the owner's city will no longer be able to spread loyalty pressure on your city.

The strategic resources the city is accumulating will have an additional +1 per turn. When taking office in the capital of a foreign country [ICON_Capital], you can accumulate the city's strategic resources and obtain the city's luxury resources.

Each international [ICON_TradeRoute] trade route through this city +3 [ICON_Gold] gold coin income per turn. When taking office in the capital of a foreign country [ICON_Capital], the city owner's [ICON_STAT_GRIEVANCE] grievance against you will decrease by 1 point each turn.
Allows cities to purchase regions with [ICON_Gold] gold or [ICON_Faith] faith. In this city's tile, all [ICON_Governor] Governor's units fully heal in one turn.
The characteristic chief executive of Fei Yixiang. Provide diplomacy and city-state related enhancements. Can be assigned to city-states.
Can be assigned to city-states, equivalent to 2 [ICON_Envoy] envoys. Enemy spies in this city will operate at a level 2 lower than normal.
After being dispatched to a city-state, you can get the luxury resources and strategic resources of the city-state.
Other cities within 9 tiles of you gain +2 Loyalty to your civilization each turn. Other cities that are within 9 cells and do not belong to you will lose 2 points of loyalty each turn.
Each international [ICON_TradeRoute] trade route through this city has +3 [ICON_Gold] gold coin income per round. The strategic resources the city is accumulating will have an additional +1 per turn.
An [ICON_TradeRoute] with this city as the destination will provide +2 [ICON_Food] to the starting city. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for all friendly units fighting within the city territory.

When serving in a city-state, you can double the number of [ICON_Envoy] envoys in that city-state. Can build city park improvements in this city. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +2 Charisma. +1 [ICON_Amenities] satisfaction if adjacent to water.
Part of the ability of other civilizations can be seized, and the opponent loses the ability to be seized. [NEWLINE]Capabilities can only be captured from one civilization at a time.
Bleach Spirit Dress·One Three Three Fans
Cities built gain additional territories. [ICON_TradeRoute] trade routes established with more advanced civilizations can provide [ICON_Science] technology value or [ICON_Culture] culture value.
Clear the currently seized ability and choose again.

Friendly to civilizations whose [ICON_Science] technology value and [ICON_Culture] value are ahead of his. Hate civilizations that lack [ICON_Science] technology and [ICON_Culture] culture. [NEWLINE]Will attempt to form multiple alliances, respecting the civilizations that form alliances. Dislikes civilizations with few alliances. [NEWLINE]Will not attack neighbors unless they fail to keep diplomatic commitments. Likes civilizations that live in peace with their neighbors, and dislikes civilizations that go to war with their neighbors. [NEWLINE] I like Tokisaki Kurumi.
Unlocks the unique unit, the Sirius.

Gain [ICON_Strength] combat power boost from adjacent dead units (up to 10 points). When the land unit defeats the main or non-main civilization opponent unit, it will get [ICON_GreatGeneral] general points, and when the navy unit defeats the opponent unit, it will get [ICON_GreatAdmiral] naval commander points, the amount obtained is equal to 25% of the opponent's combat power (at standard speed).

Will try to conquer neighboring civilizations, likes civilizations that are not yet adjacent to it. Dislike neighboring countries. [NEWLINE]Will attempt to build high-level walls around cities, respecting like-minded civilizations. Hate civilizations that don't fortify their cities. [NEWLINE]Would never sign humiliating peace terms, prefer civilizations that fit that style. Hates civilizations that succumb to force or never use force. Grudges against this leader are reduced twice as fast. [NEWLINE] I like Tokisaki Kurumi.
When a land unit defeats a main or non-main civilization opponent unit, it will gain [ICON_GreatGeneral] points equal to 25% of the opponent's combat power (at standard speed).
When a naval unit defeats a main or non-main civilization opponent unit, gain [ICON_GreatAdmiral] Naval Admiral Points (at standard speed) equal to 25% of the opponent's combat power.
Cang's unique medieval melee unit. With unique upgrade options and free upgrades right from the start. Upon completion, the population of the city [ICON_Citizen] is reduced by 1.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in all situations. [NEWLINE]Add +5 [ICON_Strength] combat strength when defending.
Gain culture when killing an enemy unit.
If [ICON_Movement] mobility allows, +2 extra attack per round.
Get healed at the end of the round.
+3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in all situations. [NEWLINE]Add +15 [ICON_Strength] combat strength when attacking.
+7 These warriors are protected by demon armor.
+5 Demon Armor reveals its true potential when defended by its owner.
+3 No matter the owner of the authentic blade uses it for attack or defense, it is very convenient.
+15 The Masamune Blade reveals its true potential when its master is attacking.
The ruler of the neighboring fourth realm, with spiral hair, wearing a light blue shirt and miniskirt.
Lunar solar term four solar terms
Get 1 [ICON_GreatProphet] Great Prophet for free. Gain apostles if religion is established.
The blond girl, the former ruler of the Ninth Realm.
Your builders can now build city park improvements.
Ruler of the eighth realm. Long black hair, gorgeous kimono, often covered with a fan, giving people the impression of an elegant and dignified lady.
When killing a unit, there is a certain chance to capture the unit.
The ruler of the sixth realm, with lavender hair, wearing a white shirt and pleated skirt, has an elegant temperament.
Overland [ICON_TradeRoute] trade routes are immune to looting.
